intro: Draba cretacea, commonly known as the Crete whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found on the island of Crete. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and cruciform petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Draba cretacea is known for its low-growing habit and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
